lead_paragraph: NYTimes.com readers had mixed to positive reactions to "Chinglish," David Henry Hwang's new comedy about Chinese-American relations (and relationships) that opened on Broadway last week. Some found the show's approach to linguistic and cultural confusion humorous; others thought that it had a one-note plot and that the jokes failed to land. (In his review for The New York Times, Ben Brantley called "Chinglish" a "sporadically funny" play "laid out with the frame-by-frame exactness of a comic strip.")

headline.main: Curtain Down, Heads Up: Readers Review 'Chinglish'
